result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R Stroeh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin R Stroeh is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin R Stroeh was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Benjamin R Stroeh was found guilty of 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Restitution hearing scheduled for 2-26-2015 at 8:30am.
**2/26/2015  Ordered in the amont of $2,062.61 to be paid to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.  Court ordered $1,500.00 of cash bail to apply.  Remaining bail of $1,500.00 to be returned to poster.  Court ordered defendant to pay the remaining amont of restitution during probation period.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No fine.
Pay costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges during the term of probation or extended supervision or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
Pay monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in institution.
DOC collect money sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.
Maintain full time employment; if not employed full time, a minimum of 20 hours per week of education/schooling.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact order - with the victim and/or witnesses.
No accounts on any social media, dating internet sites, etc.

Sex offender treatment & counseling if deemed appropriate.
Cognitive thinking therapy - if not included in the Sex offender treatment.
Register as a sex offender for a period of 15 years after the term of extended supervision has been served.
Any other treatment  or programs recommended by the agent.
Email account and computer ownership is ok.
Any electronic devices to be made available for inspection by the agent on demand.
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment if deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Random screens.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for restitution hearing. Defense counsel requests restitution not be taken out of the bail on deposit. Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $2,062.61 to be paid to the Crime Victim Compensation fund. Court ordered $1,500.00 of the cash bail posted be applied towards the restitution amount first. Remaining cash bail of $1,500.00 to be returned to poster. Court ordered defendant to pay the remaining amount of restitution during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution worksheet with attached documentation received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Certification of transcript of proceedings of JURY TRIAL commencing OCTOBER 27, 2014 received and filed. (142 Pages.)
Count two.
Count one.
Restitution hearing scheduled for 02-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  No corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by C.W., the State, defense counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 1:
Court orders defendant to serve 262 days, with credit for 262 days - TIME SERVED.

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  8 years with Zero days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  3 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5 years.  Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 5 years.
 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION and Probation:
-  AODA assessment and any recommended treatment if deemed appropriate
-  Maintain Absolute Sobriety
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Random Screens
-  No Contact Order - with the victim and/or witnesses
-  Sex Offender Treatment & Counseling if deemed appropriate
-  Cognitive Thinking Therapy - if not included in the Sex Offender treatment
-  Register as a Sex Offender for a period of 15 years after the term of extended supervision has been served
-  Case to be adjourned for restitution hearing
-  Maintain full-time employment; if not employed full-time, a minimum of 20 hours per week of education/schooling
-  Any other treatment or programs recommended by the agent
-  No accounts on any social media, dating, etc internet sites
-  Email account and computer ownership is ok
-  Any electronic devices to be made available for inspection by the agent on demand
-  No fine
-  Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation or extended supervision or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.  
-  pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Court orders case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 25.

Clerk received an email from the DOC requesting that the date the PSI is due to the Court be extended to 12/15/14. Presentence Investigation report is now due to the court by 12/15/14. Sentencing hearing remains scheduled for 01/07/15 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for bail hearing. Defendant was remanded at the plea hearing in front of Judge Pocan on 10/27/14. Defense counsel requests the court reinstate the cash bail. State objects. Additional arguments heard. Court set cash bail at $3,000.00 with turnover to Justice Point monitoring. Defendant not to be released until Justice Point independently verifies, the residence, people living at that residence, the exact address of the residence, and the phone number of that residence. Conditions of bail as follows:
-Do not commit any new offenses. 
-No contact with the victim or any person listed in the No Contact Order dated 3/27/14. 
-Do not own or possess any firearms or ammunition.
-No firearm may be in the residence in which the defendant will reside in.
-Obtain and maintain employment. Justice Point to verify employment status. 

Case remains scheduled for Sentencing Hearing on 1/07/15 at 8:30 a.m. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Court DENIED defense motion for modification of bail.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   FOR BRANCH 25.  On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED.   As to the amended charges in COUNTS 1 and 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armor warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  PSI ordered, signed, and forwarded to probation department.    
  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. Discussion regarding witnesses from both parties. Branch 25 also has a homicide trial scheduled for today. Case passed to locate spin court and address calendar. Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Branch 38 agreed to hear this matter for Branch 25. Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   FOR BRANCH 25.   On motion of the State, Court ordered charge in COUNT 1 amended to Substantial Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(2), a Class I felony and COUNT 2 amended to 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3), a Class G felony.   Amended Information filed by the state.  Defense waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was spun from Branch 25.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Court finds that the defendant has waived his speedy trial demand and may reassert.  Parties are advised the Felony Court Coordinator reassigned case to Judge Pocan, Br. 26 FORTHWITH.
Parties and defendant are ordered to report to Branch 26.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney John C Moore.  Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for continued bail hearing. Copy of defendant's lease and proof of employment received and filed. Additional arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered cash bail adjusted down to $3,000.00 with turnover to Justice Point GPS Monitoring. Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with the victim, victim's residence or witnesses in this case. Defendant is to make all future court dates and not possess any firearms. Defendant is allowed release for work. Court allowed 1 hour on either side of work hours to address personal matters. Defense counsel will be filing a Miranda-Goodchild motion. Defense motion to be filed by 05/12/2014 at 5:00 p.m. Defense counsel requested final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State. Court ordered this matter adjourned for continued bail hearing and scheduling conference. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney John C. Moore.  Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Behning-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CCW (WOMAN YOU ADMITTED YOU HAD SEX WITH ON OCTOBER 13, 2013);, ETHAN B, ELIZABETH F. AND KELLY D-H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Benjamin R Stroeh in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
